basic_information.college_name: College of Fine Arts and Design

description: This scholarship was established in 2007 by School of Music faculty member Dr. Lori Wooden to honor her first bassoon teacher, Jill Marderness, and provide assistance to students studying the bassoon. Eligibility Bassoon major Cumulative GPA 3.0+ Sophomore, junior, senior or graduate student Enrolled full time (12+ hours undergraduate, 9+ hours graduate) Requirements Personal Artist Statement (250 Words) Official Transcript Responsibilities Recipient required to participate in the UCO Symphony Orchestra and/or Wind Symphony, the Wind Chamber Music Program, and represent the School of Music at the spring audition days Recipient required to make a contribution to the community through outreach performances and presentations to area schools and organizations

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship
